bibl.title: Fever chart for Daniel Le May, [1900]

div1.head: Fever chart for Daniel Le May, [1900]
div1.p: Probable source and nature of infection:

p.add:
{with one exception that in w Dr the cases among officers have been con
{fined to one set of quarters; that being the usual course the disease traveling
{from quarters to quarters in regular gradations.

div1.p:
when first saw patient suffered from pain in head & limbs rheumatic in character
great thirst, insomnia. Headache severe especially on moving the occipital fron
tal muscles There was decided superficial tenderness especially noticible upon
pinching the skin. defervescence on the 19th with very decided prostration. As yet
no rash has appeared. There was decidedly greater prostration in his case

than in any I have noticed. 22'd appetite returning gradually, but patient is still
weak
Bowels Kept free & Easily assimable diet.
